Description: A race of old, the ancient Dwarves are a strong and traditional people.

Creation.Stat Restrictions:
Your Might must be at least 1.
Your lowest stat must be either Dexterity or Charisma.

~Proficiency in Crafting~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for crafting items (e.g. improvised traps, weapons or tools, rafts, structures, setting up a tent, etc).

~Proficiency in History~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for recalling past events from the lore of the world (e.g. wars, events, etc).

~Proficiency in Dungeoneering~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for navigating dungeons and identifying traps, secret doors, dungeon monsters, etc.

Language: You speak Common, Dwarvish and if your Intelligence is at least 1, you speak one more language of choice.

~Dwarf Resting~.Effect: As a Dwarf, you sleep in one single 8 hour cycle, without dreaming or moving in your sleep. You can also choose to hibernate for up to 48 hours without needing to eat or drink. If you do, you cure all normal diseases and poisons on you.
~Dwarf Resting~.Notes: Loud noises and movement still wake you up as they normally would.

~Thick Feet~.Effect: Your movement speed can't be reduced below 4 meters by Crowd Control or Armor.
~Thick Feet~.Notes:
Your speed not being able to be reduced applies to being Slowed and Dazed. You are not immune to Roots.
Hard Terrain still takes 2 meters of movement for 1 meter of Hard Terrain.

Starting Abilities Description.Dwarf Resting:
Dwarves are slow folk - they usually need a lot of rest to be able to do their tasks.
However, that does not mean they are lazy; quite the contrary. Dwarves make very good use of their limited time.
On vacations, Dwarves ocasionally hibernate for longer periods.
While awake, Dwarves are very sturdy; hence their increased Health, Dwarven Resilience and not having their speed reduced by Armor or Slows.

Starting Abilities Description.Dwarven Resilience:
Combat Checks are special types of Checks that happen from enemy Abilities.
These Combat Checks are not usually optional. For example, an enemy could make you make a Dexterity Combat Check to dodge an attack.
If you fail it, you can just choose to do the roll again.
Then you must wait until you do a Long Rest to be able to do this again.

~Stone-Like Bones~.Effect:
Your bones are tough as rock.
You only take 50% damage from falling and from traps that deal physical damage.
Your Reserve Health pool increases by 3.

~Runesmith~.Effect:
You permanently know 2 Generic Abilities from the Arcane or Conjuration Spell Lists.
You gain Proficiency in Arcana (see Proficiencies).
~Runesmith~.Notes:
You can't change these Spells on a Long Rest, so choose wisely.
You must still respect the Level requirement for these Spells, if any.

~Adapted Resting~.Effect: After a Long Rest, you start with 1d8 Shielding that lasts for up to 24 hours.

~Skill of Trade~.Effect:
Your Charisma increases by 1 (up to a maximum of +3).
You can get free shelter and food in inns and taverns (if you would normally be able to pay for them).
You gain an extra +5 to Checks when checking stone walls, doors, statues, etc.
